title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 20 April 2016 - XWiki

11:01 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
11:03 <vmassol> has quit  
11:03 <flashdel> has joined #xwiki  
11:05 <flashdel> hi folks, i am using xwiki 8.0 and if i am using charakters like [] in the page title, my page gets broken with "HTTP Status 500 - Invalid URL" error. How can i rename the page without special chars and is it possible to forbid using them in the page title?  
11:08 <lkrejci> has quit  
11:09 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
11:09 <ClemensR> braces in the page title should work without problems  
11:09 <ClemensR> I guess there is a problem with your server configuration. is apache or ngninx in front of it ?  
11:10 <flashdel> its nginx  
11:11 <flashdel> all the other pages are working fine  
11:12 <ClemensR> sigh, I know very little about nginx.  if you try to access the servlet container directly, does the error still happen ?  
11:12 <tmortagne> is this a XWiki error or a nginx error ?  
11:13 <tmortagne> "HTTP Status 500 - Invalid URL" does not ring any bell so it really looks like some nginx filtering  
11:13 <tmortagne> like apache filtering URL with encoded slash etc by default  
11:19 <flashdel> basically its a tomcat error, if i access the url "https://wiki.my-domain.de/xwiki/bin/view/Administration/OwnCloud+Doku+[externe+Leute]" it get rewritten(?) to http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Administration/OwnCloud+Doku+[externe+Leute]  
11:20 <tmortagne> this URL does not look right  
11:20 <tmortagne> braket are supposed to be encoded  
11:20 <tmortagne> are you writing this URL by hand or is this generated ?  
11:24 <flashdel> i saved the page with the title, and if i click on it and this error appears. I have to say that i recently upgraded from 7.2, maybe something broke?  
11:25 <ClemensR> it worked with 7.2 ?  
11:25 <flashdel> i`m not really sure :(  
11:25 <tmortagne> I don't think it has anything to do with XWiki since it does not looks like XWiki error  
11:26 <flashdel> is there a way to rename that page without being able to access it properly? Maybe that solves my problem  
11:27 <ClemensR> hm, no "rename page" snippet on http://extensions.xwiki.org  
11:27 <tmortagne> flashdel: you will need to write a script for it, something like http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Clean+slashes+from+document+names  
11:27 <ClemensR> ah, there :)  
11:28 <tmortagne> you can probably copy/paste this script and just modify the part about slash to deal with brakets  
11:31 <flashdel> ok, i will check that  
11:33 <flashdel> it did work \o/ thank you very much!  
11:34 <flashdel> so is there a plugin which forbids using special chars? or shouldnt that happen?  
11:36 <tmortagne> XWiki is support to support anything, but then tomcat and whatever is in front on tomcat had to support those too  
11:36 <ClemensR> actually it should not happen. currently there is no such plugin  
11:36 <tmortagne> s/had/has/  
11:44 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
11:49 <Evi\_> has joined #xwiki  
11:55 <Evi\_> hello, I would like to modify the default presentation of user settings (right now there are all the available fields: Profile, Preferences, Watchlist, Network, Wikis, My dashboard). Is there a possibility to hide some fields?  
12:00 <vmassol> has quit  
12:09 <lkrejci> has quit  
12:30 <ClemensR> @Evi\_ you can change the profile section easily o the wiki admin, section "User & Groups" -> "User profile".   I would have to check how to modify the sections; that is certainly possible but has no nice admin UI  
12:32 <ClemensR> you can edit the page "XWikiUserSheet"  in the "XWiki" space - if you edit this with the wiki editor you can see how the sections are put together in velocity code  
12:33 <ClemensR> stuff like:  #set($discard = $categories.add({'id':'watchlist', 'sheet':'XWiki.XWikiUserWatchListSheet', 'glyphicon': 'eye-open'}))  
12:34 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
12:38 <lkrejci> has quit  
12:38 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
12:38 <lkrejci> has quit  
12:38 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
12:42 <Slashman> has quit  
12:56 <Evi\_> @ClemensR thank you very much for your answer. I see the velocity code of the "XWikiUserSheet". May you explain how I can hide, e.g. the id watchlist? Is it done by deleting the lines e.g. #if($isMyProfile && $hasDashboard)   #set($discard = $categories.add({'id':'dashboard', 'sheet':'Dashboard.XWikiUserDashboardSheet', 'glyphicon': 'th'})) #end?  
12:58 <ClemensR> that is the dashboard :)  
12:59 <ClemensR> wachlist should be above starting with :  #if($isMyProfile && $hasWatch)  
13:00 <ClemensR> you can also just comment it by adding a '##'  at the start of the line  
13:01 <Evi\_> yes, sorry - anyhow it doesn't really matter for me if it's the watchlist or the dashboard. I just want to figure out how to hide any of the fields. Alright thanks, I will try it by comment the lines out.  
13:03 <ClemensR> commenting out should just work.  also if just hiding it via CSS would be good enough, you could try a CSS extension, as explained here:  http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/SkinExtensionsTutorial\  
13:04 <ClemensR> (mostly talks about JavaScript but works with CSS as well)  
13:06 <Evi\_> commenting worked - yeah! :) thank you so much, ClemensR! Made my day. ^^  
13:06 <ClemensR> glad to help :)  
13:17 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
13:17 <msmeria> has quit  
13:38 <lkrejci> has quit  
13:38 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
13:47 <Evi\_> I have another question. This time it is more about asking for a suggestion. I'm setting up user groups and user rights. Would you recommend to give by default all user groups the rights to view and to edit content? Or is it better to give a "rather untechnical experienced and kind of afraid of new systems group" just the right to view and maybe to comment content?  
13:51 <ClemensR> I think of it is a wiki, let everyone edit. you can watch the complete wiki and supervise the changes.  
13:52 <ClemensR> usually the main problem is getting people to participate, not to avoid them doing the too much  
13:56 <Evi\_> that's true. I'm just thinking about the "really technical unexperienced ones", the more buttons they see the more afraid they are. :D but yeah, the wiki philosophy is that everyone should contribute s.th. to the wiki.  
14:08 <lkrejci> has quit  
14:08 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki

15:49 <msmeria> has quit  
15:53 <Evi> has joined #xwiki  
15:59 <Evi> Hey, I'm back with another question. :) I'm not sure about the "right to script". Based on http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Scripting I assume that the user need this right to render marcos, like "Warning Macro". Then it would be good to give all users this right, right?  
16:28 <ClemensR> @Evi : nope, you only need the script right to write scripts in macros  
16:29 <ClemensR> that is somewhat close to "programming", and causal users do not need that. they can use other macros like the warning macro without that scripting right  
16:31 <ClemensR> it is just the five "programming language" macros that are affected  
16:37 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
16:46 <Evi> okay, thx, ClemensR!

17:52 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
17:56 <acotiuga> Hello! Is it possible to add a xobject to a document using an existing form that uses the action 'save'? Would it be the same as $doc.save()?  
18:08 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
18:12 <acotiuga> I see something interesting here: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Standard+URL+Format#HParameter:objectPolicy  
18:13 <woshilapin> has quit  
18:20 <tmortagne> acotiuga: yes that's the right thing to look at :)  
18:20 <tmortagne> (never used it myself yet but I need to play with it for some use cases I have)  
18:22 <acotiuga> I already have the form with the property names as : XWiki.XWikiRights\_0\_levels, so my only need it to create XWiki.XWikiRights\_0 which is done using objectPolicy. I already love this :)  
18:23 <evalica> has quit  
18:25 <tmortagne> that's what I understood too
